Southwest Vermont Supervisory Union
June 10 at 9:17 AM ·

Congratulations on your retirement, Mr. Coggeshall!

Steve Coggeshall has been working at Mt. Anthony Union High School for 33 years. He started right out of grad school and never looked back. "I started teaching when I was about 30 years old," he said. "I decided I wanted to do something more positive and more fulfilling with my life."

Throughout his many years at MAUHS, Mr. Coggeshall was the advisor for the progressives club, the head of his department, and a tennis coach.

Due to increasing concerns about the spread of the Covid-19 Coronavirus, the MAUHS/SVSU community has made the decision to cancel the 2020 Pop Concerts scheduled for March 12, 13 & 14. This decision was made to protect the health and safety of our student performers, audience members, and their families.

Refunds for tickets purchased in-person at the school are available immediately from Christina Gabrus in the main office. We are beginning the process for refunding tickets purchased online and hope to complete that process as soon as possible.

We are exploring alternative performance options in the coming days (live-streaming, CAT-TV, posting recordings online etc.) We will let you know when a decision has been made.

Thank you to all the students for their hard work in preparing for these concerts.

Did you know that we offer a Sports Journalism class? Mr. Upright’s class runs the school’s sports newspaper, the Patriot Press.
Yesterday, the newsroom was hard at work tightening up the two paragraph leads they insert at the beginning of all of the articles. This makes sure people get the vital information at the top of each article. Other members of the class worked on editing articles for the Winter Sports Preview.
In the class, students get assigned different beats that they must follow throughout the semester - Girls Basketball, Boys Basketball, Wrestling, X-Country Skiing, Swimming, Indoor Track, Competition Cheerleading, and Dance Team, name a few.
The paper comes out 7-10 times a year and gets delivered to classrooms and areas all over the school.

November 8, 2019 at 12:20 PM ·

Ms. West’s 9th grade English class kicked off their Shakespeare unit with a guest speaker today. Conor Mullen, a theater artist, came to talk to students about weapons and violence in Shakespeare’s plays. Mr. Mullen, who trained with Shakespeare & Company, is the founding member of Dispatch Combat Collective, an organization that seeks to make stage combat more accessible and safe for working actors. He spoke with the students about the importance of safety and repeat-ability when choreographing stage combat. He also noted that a fight scene is placed in a production not for the sake of violence, but to enrich the story line. Ms. West was excited to welcome Mr. Mullen into the classroom, saying that the presentation will enhance the student’s understanding of the more violent scenes of Romeo and Juliet, which they will be starting next week.

Mount Anthony Union High School added 12 new photos.
October 18, 2019 at 2:24 PM ·

High School Art Teacher Liz Howe has partnered with Bennington College senior Michelle Freeman to offer pottery workshops for student, faculty, and staff. The fruits of their labor won’t be tchotchkes on a shelf though – Ms. Howe and Michelle are teaching students and staff a variety of ceramic techniques to make bowls for the upcoming Empty Bowls Soup Dinner, hosted by the Greater Bennington Interfaith Community Services.

Though students have been working on the project for a while now, interested staff members took a workshop today, creating bowls to be donated. In total, the school will be donating approximately 60 bowls to the event. Ms. Howe hopes to make this an annual event at the high school to support the larger Bennington Community.

The Empty Bowls Soup Dinner will be held at MAUMS Sunday, November. 17. Visit
www.benningtoncares.org for more information.
